conventional.name: Conventional System
conventional.description: A standard, gravity-fed system with a septic tank and a gravel-and-pipe drain field. Best for properties with ideal soil and space.

chamber.name: Chamber System
chamber.description: Uses interlocking chambers instead of gravel. Requires less space and is suitable for areas where gravel is scarce.

drip.name: Drip Distribution System
drip.description: Uses small tubing to slowly distribute effluent over a large area. Ideal for shallow soil, steep slopes, or wooded lots.

aerobic.name: Aerobic Treatment Unit (ATU)
aerobic.description: Uses oxygen to treat wastewater to a higher quality. Necessary for poor soil, small lots, or near sensitive water bodies.

mound.name: Mound System
mound.description: An engineered drain field built above the natural ground. Required for high water tables, shallow bedrock, or very poor soil.
